simple_nerf_timed module¶

simple_nerf_timed.py

Implements a timing benchmark for training a Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) model using PyTorch. Uses positional encoding, MLP architecture, volume rendering, and measures total runtime for a fixed number of steps on GPU or CPU.

class simple_nerf_timed.NeRF(pos_dim=10, dir_dim=4)[source]¶

Bases: Module

Neural Radiance Field model composed of two branches: one for density and one for RGB based on direction and intermediate features.

Parameters:

  • pos_dim – Frequency bands for positional input encoding.

  • dir_dim – Frequency bands for direction input encoding.

forward(x, d)[source]¶

Forward pass through the NeRF network.

Parameters:

  • x – Sample positions, shape (N, 3)

  • d – Viewing directions, shape (N, 3)

Returns:

RGB and density values, shape (N, 4)

class simple_nerf_timed.PositionalEncoding(num_freqs, include_input=True)[source]¶

Bases: Module

Sinusoidal positional encoding module.

Parameters:

  • num_freqs – Number of frequency bands.

  • include_input – Whether to include original input in encoding.

forward(x)[source]¶

Apply encoding to the input tensor.

Parameters:

x – Input tensor of shape (…, input_dim)

Returns:

Encoded tensor of shape (…, encoded_dim)

simple_nerf_timed.train_nerf()[source]¶

Trains a NeRF model and prints total execution time.

The function simulates a basic 32x32 ray field and trains a small NeRF model using synthetic data (radial gradient). Total execution time is printed in seconds.

simple_nerf_timed.volume_rendering(rgb_sigma, z_vals)[source]¶

Performs alpha compositing to compute final pixel RGB values.

Parameters:

  • rgb_sigma – Tensor of shape (N, S, 4) [RGB, sigma]

  • z_vals – Tensor of shape (N, S) sample depths

Returns:

Rendered RGB image of shape (N, 3)
